document_info.title: Efficiency of Mimosa Cold Water Extraction - 2025 Discussion
document_info.purpose: Discussion on cold water extraction as gentler alternative to boiling for mimosahuasca
document_info.disclaimer: Educational reference only. Documents extraction chemistry discussions.

original_question.context: Reading old threads on cold water extraction for Mimosa
original_question.consensus_from_old_threads: Much less tannins and gunk extracted compared to boiling
original_question.personal_reason: Body seemed to reject tannins (egg tek wasn't enough) - stopped using Mimosa
original_question.historical_note: Many old CWEs done for drinking without harmalas - requires much higher dose
original_question.key_question: How efficient is CWE compared to simmering for mimosahuasca use?

yuremamine_consideration.concern: Don't forget about Yuremamine with cold soak
yuremamine_consideration.solution: If reducing tea later, not a problem
yuremamine_consideration.harmala_interaction: Unknown beyond potentiating MAOI - advised caution

steps: Soak and hydrate with minimal water
12/24h CWE with equal volume water (regular mixing)
Filter and squeeze through cotton cloth 3x
Let settle and filter with coffee filter

cold_oil_extraction_idea.inspiration: How people make St. John's wort oil
cold_oil_extraction_idea.method: Crush/powder plant, put in bottle with good quality oil, soak for weeks, shake sometimes
cold_oil_extraction_idea.question: Could very long soak without freebasing work and extract other actives?
cold_oil_extraction_idea.potential_problem: May not be concentrated enough - large oil amount needed = stomach trouble

responses.northape: Ingesting large quantities of oil with harmalas sounds like disaster
responses.transform: Maybe for skin-care but doubt viable psychoactive use

cold_oil_extraction_idea.sakkadelic_note: Does this for mandrake extraction - warm baths or cold works equally well
cold_oil_extraction_idea.follow_up_question: What if acidic water added to enriched oil - would DMT migrate to water layer?

caapi_dosage_discussion.thp_report: Author reports needing only 10g caapi for Aya
caapi_dosage_discussion.variability: Caapi vine on market varies greatly in strength

water_ratios.sakkadelic_minimal: Try to keep water minimal to avoid reduction step

key_technical_points.extraction_time: May need more than 12/24 hours depending on climate
key_technical_points.dmt_solubility: Quite soluble in water at cold/room temp
key_technical_points.tannin_note: Other stuff tends to appear more when solution is heated

practical_tips.save_bark: Keep bark after CWE - use in next extraction if CWE was ineffective
practical_tips.batch_processing: Easier to process larger batches than single doses
practical_tips.squeezing: Can minimize water by squeezing through cloth - forces water out vs relying on diffusion

oil_extraction_chemistry.freebasing_first: Makes sense to freebase before adding oil (lime to avoid saponification?)
oil_extraction_chemistry.backsalting: Add acidic water to enriched oil - DMT should migrate to water layer
oil_extraction_chemistry.transform_suggestion: DMT benzoate may be soluble in vegetable oil
oil_extraction_chemistry.data_needed: Would be nice to get solubility data for DMT salts and freebase in different vegetable oils

parameters.water_type: Spring water with dash of vinegar

results.strength: EXCELLENT - considerably stronger than same amount in normal brew
results.comparison: Similarly strong to pharma dosing (40mg DMT + 30mg redose)

blig_blug_test.sediment: Absolutely no sediment without decanting - major plus
blig_blug_test.tannin_issue: Hopes for less tannin didn't materialize - seemed same as boiled
blig_blug_test.side_effects: Not much nausea but very strong stomach pain throughout
blig_blug_test.conclusion: CWE is SUPERIOR to boiling - simpler method, stronger and longer lasting result

parameters.additional_settling: 3 more days for gunk to sink, then decanted again
parameters.harmalas: 200mg freebase in capsule, 50 mins before drinking

blimey_test.palatability: Fairly astringent but not too tanniny, fairly palatable
blimey_test.onset: Within 20-30 mins knew it would work
blimey_test.purge: Purged once during come up, nausea faded after
blimey_test.duration: Around 5 hours of quality therapeutic solo time in forest
blimey_test.comparison_to_boiled: CWE much easier (less variables), albeit more time consuming
blimey_test.vinegar_note: Would leave out vinegar - may affect yuremamine

cwe_tek_procedure.author: blig-blug
steps: 1. Put MHRB in vessel, add 30ml non-chlorinated water per gram
2. Add dash of vinegar or lemon juice, shake well
3. Let rest 24h in fridge or cool place, shaking from time to time
4. Strain and filter finer sediments (paper towel on strainer works)

dosing.beginner: Start with 45ml, redose after 2 hours if not strong enough
dosing.experienced: Use same equivalent grams as with boiled brew

cwe_tek_procedure.notes: Amounts and durations are somewhat arbitrary - experimentation needed

tannin_removal_attempts.egg_tek_limitation: Involves boiling - destroys heat sensitive components like yuremamine
tannin_removal_attempts.lime_addition: Tannins precipitate when lime added - leaves golden solution of freebase
tannin_removal_attempts.pvpp_option: Substance used to remove tannins from wine - to be tested
tannin_removal_attempts.agar_agar_idea: northape suggested using instead of egg whites to bind tannins

transform_advice.sodium_carbonate: Tannins might stay dissolved - hoping for clean separation is far-fetched
transform_advice.dmt_behavior: As likely to float as sink, may oil out rather than behave conveniently
transform_advice.salt_addition: Can add salt to ensure alkaloids float - spoon off goo or swirl onto toothpick
